intro: Quinchamalium tenue, commonly known as the slender quinchamalium, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and knotweed. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in late spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a smooth texture, often with a slight pubescence. Quinchamalium tenue is primarily of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
